data.title: Gloria Stuart
data.meta_description: The actress Gloria Stuart received her greatest public acclaim in her 87th year, becoming the oldest person to be nominated for an Oscar as Old Rose in James Cameron’s Titanic.It was 50 years or so
data.text:
The actress Gloria Stuart received her greatest public acclaim in her 87th year, becoming the oldest person to be nominated for an Oscar as Old Rose in James Cameron’s Titanic.

It was 50 years or so since she had last enjoyed acting success. She had given a noteworthy performance in James Whale’s cult classic Old Dark House (1932, an adaptation of J. B. Priestley’s Benighted) with Charles Laughton, Raymond Massey and Boris Karloff. She had played opposite Claude Rains in The Invisible Man (1933); as the ingénue in Gold Diggers (1935); and in Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm (1938) with Shirley Temple.
